Package micycle.pgs

Class PGS_Conversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • micycle.pgs.PGS_Conversion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants
    public class PGS_Conversion
extends Object
implements processing.core.PConstants
    Conversion between Processing PShapes and JTS Geometries.

    Methods in this class are used by the library but are kept accessible for more advanced user use cases.

    Author:
    Michael Carleton

    • Method Detail

      • toPShape

        public static processing.core.PShape toPShape​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry g)
        Converts a JTS Geometry to an equivalent PShape. MultiGeometries (collections of geometries) become GROUP PShapes with children shapes.
        Parameters:
        g -
        source - PShape to copy fill/stroke details from
        Returns:

      • toPShape

        public static processing.core.PShape toPShape​(Collection<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry> geometries)
        Converts a collection of JTS Geometries to an equivalent GROUP PShape.

      • fromPShape

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry fromPShape​(processing.core.PShape shape)
        Converts a PShape to an equivalent JTS Geometry.

        PShapes with bezier curves are sampled at regular intervals (in which case the resulting geometry will have more vertices than the input)

        For now, a PShape with multiple children is flattened/unioned since most library methods are not (yet) programmed to handle multi/disjoint geometries.

        Parameters:
        shape -
        Returns:
        a JTS Polygon or MultiPolygon

      • toPVector

        public static List<processing.core.PVector> toPVector​(processing.core.PShape shape)
        Returns the vertices of a PShape as an unclosed list of PVector coordinates.
        Parameters:
        shape -
        Returns:

      • fromPVector

        public static processing.core.PShape fromPVector​(List<processing.core.PVector> coords)
        Generate a simple polygon (no holes) from the given coordinate list. Used by randomPolygon().

      • getChildren

        public static processing.core.PShape getChildren​(processing.core.PShape shape,
                                                 List<processing.core.PShape> visited)
        Kinda recursive, caller must provide fresh arraylist. Output includes the parent-most (input) shape. Output is flattened, does not respect a hierarchy of parent-child PShapes.
        Parameters:
        shape -
        visited -
        Returns:
